Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but yes, most messages will be small

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> like emails, chats, texts

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> Text, PDFs, images (memes) will be small.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> imagine being able to send a meme pic via encrypted memo field!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that is one of my goals

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> 200KB is a lot of room for meme pics

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> small files take the least work, since they fit in 1 transaction

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> next level of complexity is medium files, which take up multiple transactions but still inside one block (but could straddle multiple blocks)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> then finally files which take up multiple blocks to store

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so it's like baby steps to the market, little steps to bigger steps

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Pixelised worst case is you break up your 1 logical file into multiple files on Hush blockchain, like "will part 1", "will part 2", etc..

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> Worst case would be having a zip archive across multiple 3.5 inch 1.44MB floppy disks. üòõ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I remember those days very well

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> My first Linux install was Slackware 3.3 which took about 12  floppy disks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> block 340,000 on our new mainnet will be our halving

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it would have been block 840,000 on our original chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> 210,000 for hush, you are right, it's 840,000 for BTC, who has a block time 4 times longer

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's every 4 years, for both

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> same as Zcash as well

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Zcash halving will happen first, then Hush not too long after that. I think our halving is in November 2020 (because our genblock was November 2016), but i would need to write some code to get better estimates.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> our hashrate has been changing a lot so it's hard to estimate when a block will happen over a long period of time, but late 2020 will be our 1st halving, total block reward will go from 12.5 to 6.25

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so get in on all these good block rewards for the next 1-ish year üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <AkiraX> How does bitmex work?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> You put in BTC and you lose it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It allows leveraged positions, which many people do not understand

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Most people end up losing money on Bitmex, but some people are good/lucky

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <ITM> @AkiraX You long or short bitcoin with leverage. Bet against the price. 
I first long bitcoin 7700, it went down, had to rebase/level of my entry by buying more. then 8100 I close and open a short with profits only. Loss all profits. I open a long again since 3 times my shorts all got REKT (liquidated). Hard to rebase/level off on a short. My long 8300 => 9300. I close and open a short. I did make lot profit. But 4 days no sleep. Profit was  0.19btc.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> i saw some stats recently but i don't have them handy, about average bitmex user profit
